data.title: win32無法編譯，experimental::Viewport建構式錯誤

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
cocos\platform\CCGLView.cpp
line:230
應該改為
    experimental::Viewport vp((float)(x \* _scaleX + _viewPortRect.origin.x),
        (float)(y \* _scaleY + _viewPortRect.origin.y),
        (float)(w \* _scaleX),
        (float)(h \* _scaleY));
//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
cocos\platform\desktop\CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp
line:554
應該改為  
experimental::Viewport vp((float)(x \* _scaleX \* _retinaFactor \* _frameZoomFactor + _viewPortRect.origin.x \* _retinaFactor \* _frameZoomFactor),
        (float)(y \* _scaleY \* _retinaFactor  \* _frameZoomFactor + _viewPortRect.origin.y \* _retinaFactor \* _frameZoomFactor),
        (float)(w \* _scaleX \* _retinaFactor \* _frameZoomFactor),
        (float)(h \* _scaleY \* _retinaFactor \* _frameZoomFactor));

This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body: modify bindings-generator index, fix the binding error.

data.title: `TransitionFade` isn't correctly constructed anymore.
data.body:
I've updated from 3.6 to 3.7 and noticed that TransitionFade isn't correctly constructed anymore. It seems to work just fine, but accessing `_duration` or `_inScene` through doesn't return correct values anymore.

`_duration` seems to be uninitialized, and `_inScene` is always `NULL`.

It's especially weird, since there are no changes to `CCTransition.h` or `CCTransition.cpp` from 3.6 to 3.7.

data.title: Label:Fixed the edge of character may be cropped.
Auto-Culling issue
data.body:
relate issue: #10487 
relate pr: #13105 

**Temporary solution:**
#13105 is a temporary remedy. we wanna to get a balance between bug and performance. so we choose  to check model view matrix dirty for default camera preferentially and ignore user's cameras.

**Now the result is:**
- For default camera, bug is fixed, performance almost the same with before.
- For user's cameras, bug is fixed, but get performance loss.

**What we need to do?**
- Check model view dirty for all nodes and cameras.
- Multiple cameras for a node, the difficulty is:
  - How to manage cameras' dirty? 
  - How to update cameras' dirty?
  - How to optimize search algorithm to reduce performance loss?

**Suggestion**
If you get confuse with auto-culling function, here are something you need to know. (for Sprite & Label)
- CC_USE_CULLING is a precompiled macro instead of hard coding, means that it's not a 100% optimization. The right way is enable/disable it in the appropriate environment.
- If ensure all of the Sprite/Label inside of the screen, disable auto-culling function.
- If a lot of Sprite/Label outside of screen, enable auto-culling function.
- If ensure camera is a static object, no needs to apply #13105.
- Detailed performance comparision can be found via #10487.
